text: even before the deal was done Beats
co-founder dr. Dre seen here in the
background boasted about becoming a
billionaire dr. Dre won't be a
billionaire just yet
his net worth after the deal will be
around 800 million dollars still that's
a huge sum for him and for Apple this is
the tech firms biggest acquisition yet
it's paying three billion dollars to buy
beats the headphone maker and streaming
music service Beats is the coolest thing
in the digital music world right now
they have the coolest executives they've
got a great brand and they've got a
really rapidly growing consumer base
both for the hardware and for the
digital subscription service side so
Apple is definitely grabbing onto their
coattails a little bit and trying to
keep their own brand aloft as long as
they can
beats is best known for its headphones
but for Apple the real prize is beats as
music streaming service for the past
decade Apple's iTunes has dominated
digital music but that was in the
download era these days it's all about
streaming services such as Pandora and
Spotify and even though Apple broke into
streaming last September with iTunes
radio it's felt that the company mr.
beaten is now playing catch-up Apple
hopes to make sweet music with Beats but
did it overpay with a hundred and fifty
billion dollars in cash it's a risk
Apple can easily afford in any way the
tech giant would probably argue you
can't put a price on cool Michelle
Fleury BBC News New York
